intro: Linanthus diffusus, commonly known as the spreading flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color and bloom in the summer months. Linanthus diffusus is often found in disturbed areas and can spread readily through its prolific seed production.
